alert.note: Alert for Bolivar; Sunflower (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 5:24AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sunflower and east central Bolivar Counties through 600 AM CST... At 523 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mound Bayou, or 7 miles west of Parchman, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Parchman around 530 AM CST. Rome around 535 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Merigold. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CST for northwestern Mississippi.
